place.name: LLANSTINAN
place.gazetteerText: LLANSTINAN, a parish in Haverfordwest district, Pembroke; on the West Cleddan river, 2 miles S of Fishguard, and 11½ NW of Clarbeston Road r. station. Posttown, Fishguard, under Haverfordwest. Acres, 1,579. Real property, £1,332. Pop., 174. Houses, 36. The property is divided among a few. Llanstinan House belonged to the Symmonses, passed to the Owens, and was recently restored. The liv ing is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £100.* Patron, Col. Owen. The church is dedicated to St. Justinian, and was restored in 1869. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
